item.title: Marshawn Lynch Involved In Cali Street Fight
item.dc:creator: katkmps
item.description: Marshawn Lynch is pretty much the last person you want to mess with on or off the field. Apparently a guy in California didn't get the memo when he tried to get on the wrong side of the Seahawks running back this week.
item.content:encoded:
Marshawn Lynch is pretty much the last person you want to mess with on or off the field. Apparently a guy in California didn’t get the memo when he tried to get on the wrong side of the Seahawks running back this week.

According to CBS SAN FRANCISCO ,Lynch and his entourage were hassled by an intoxicated man outside a San Francisco bar on Friday.

The man tried taunting the NFL star, allegedly calling Lynch a “Seattle sea chicken.”

Sources say, “Someone in Marshawn’s crew snapped and a melee erupted.”

In footage from the fight, it looks as if Lynch is actually attempting to pull one of his friends away from the fight but witnesses reportedly said “Marshawn got in a few punches before walking away.”

Lynch hasn’t revealed anything on social media or to the press about his involvement in the fight and the Seattle Seahawks haven’t issued a statement.

item.title: 5 Trips In 5 Days ACM Flyaways
item.dc:creator: jhayskmps
item.description: All of Country's biggest stars will be at the 50th Annual ACM Awards in Texas in April and KMPS wants to send you there to hang out with them!
item.content:encoded:
The ACM Awards are celebrating their 50th Anniversary and in the land where everything is BIG…. Texas! And KMPS wants to make sure that you and a friend will be rubbing shoulders with Country’s biggest stars!

Starting on Friday, April 13th @ 9:12PM just listen for the ACM Flyaway text code.  Be the 194th entry and you will qualify with a KMPS CD! Also listen on:

  • Saturday, March 14 from 7:12AM – 7:12PM (hourly)
  • Sunday, March 15 from 11:12AM – 5:12PM (hourly)
  • Monday, March 16 – Friday, March 20 at 7:12a, 9:12a, 11:12a, 1:12p, 3:12p and 5:12p

Listeners who qualify over the weekend will receive a CD as a qualifying prize and listeners who qualify Monday through Friday will win a pair of tickets to see Zac Brown Band at the Gorge Amphitheater on Saturday, July 11th!

Listeners who qualify Friday through Monday will be entered to win a one of a kind trip to the ACM’s courtesy of Dr. Pepper. The grand prize includes you and a friend attending the Academy of Country Music Award 50th Anniversary show LIVE from AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, tickets to the hottest concert the night before featuring Darius Rucker, and more!  You can’t buy these seats and you can’t win them without Dr. Pepper.

Listeners who qualify as the 941st entry, Tuesday through Friday, will be entered to win one of four one of kind trips to the ACM’s courtesy of WEA, Warner Music, Columbia Records and Republic Records Nashville! Not just that but your trip is planned and organized by one of the best event planners in the business, J.D. Hass! You will get airfare, hotel, transportation, excursions, parties, extra concerts and of course tickets to the ACM Awards April 19th!

Good luck!

 

*Message and data rates may apply. Will receive a confirming text message. 

*Must be 21+ to enter and win

Don’t have a phone? Enter here.

Official contest rules here.

item.title: Steven Tyler Prepping Country Album, Big Machine May Sign
item.dc:creator: cbskapost
item.description: The new album may come by the end of the year, if not next year.
item.content:encoded:
Steven Tyler, legendary frontman of Aerosmith, has not kept it a secret that he is making a country album and intends to make a full transition to a country artist, at least for the short term. This shift has included a move to Nashville and now seems to be getting a big backing.

Billboard is reporting that Big Machine Label Group is in the process of signing Tyler, and that the move could be completed in the next few weeks. The move shouldn’t be a surprise as Tyler was recently featured in a taped segment on American Idol devoted to Scott Borchetta, the group’s president and CEO.

Tyler would be joining notable signees Taylor Swift, Tim McGraw, Reba McEntire and The Band Perry. He is reportedly working with notable Nashville songwriters, including Brett James.

Read more on Radio.com.

item.title: Eagles Announce Spring, Summer U.S. Tour Dates
item.dc:creator: cbskapost
item.description: The tour kicks off May 19 in Austin, Texas.
item.content:encoded:
It seems that hell has frozen over. Again.

Yes, the Eagles are back on the road this spring and summer with a whole new set of arena dates for their long-running History of The Eagles tour.

Related: Eagles’ Don Henley Chastises Frank Ocean for Sampling ‘Hotel California’ Without Asking

The endeavor began in 2013 and is now hitting the less-traveled locations of Bakersfield, Spokane, Billings, Grand Forks, Dayton and Little Rock, among others.

Check out the dates and venues below, but don’t hold your breath for a new Eagles album, which would be the follow-up to 2007′s Long Road Out of Eden, and is still a long way from release. Ultimate Classic Rock points out, though, that this year could see the release of a new Don Henley solo album, Cass County, which has been completed since 2013.

Read more on Radio.com.

item.title: Girl with Leukemia’s Days Brightened by Luke Bryan’s Music
item.dc:creator: cbskapost
item.description: The power of music goes a long way. And in one young girl's case, specifically the sounds of Luke Bryan.
item.content:encoded:
The power of music goes a long way. And in one young girl’s case, specifically the sounds of Luke Bryan.

Two-year-old Lyanna Flynn is suffering from leukemia. According to Taste of Country, Flynn was diagnosed in February. In between chemotherapy and taking pills she doesn’t like, Bryan’s music helps her get through it.

“Luke Bryan’s music is her medicine,” her father, Chad Flynn told Taste of Country.

Appreciative of Bryan’s music during his family’s difficult time, Chad took a video of his daughter in the hospital. As she urges Lyanna to take her medicine he promises her, “After you take your medicine you can listen to your music.”

Read more on Radio.com.

item.title: Remember When Liam Neeson Was a Nice Guy?
item.dc:creator: cbskapost
item.description: Before 'Run All Night' and 'Taken,' Liam Neeson had kind of a sweet side (OK, it sometimes got a little twisted). See if you remember him in these five films.
item.content:encoded:
By Scott T. Sterling

Thanks to the runaway success of 2008 movie Taken, Liam Neeson has become one of Hollywood’s most bankable action heroes, best known for a particular set of skills: stealthily kicking bad-guy ass up and down the big screen with steely-eyed ease, all while delivering lines in his signature Irish brogue.

With a pair of Taken sequels and a series of equally ass-kicking roles since (including this weekend’s new release, Run All Night), Neeson’s reputation as cinema’s revenge-minded superstar has earned the actor a spot in the pop culture pantheon worthy of parody Super Bowl ads and hilarious Key & Peele comedy sketches.

Long before the beat-downs and dry one-liners, though, Neeson was a well-respected movie actor with a 1993 Best Actor Oscar nomination under his belt for Schindler’s List (the award would go to Tom Hanks for Philadelphia).

But even setting aside Schindler’s List, Neeson still has a diverse resume. In fact, he’s starred in quite a few decidedly non-badass movie roles during his career, all of which could come as something of a shock to the generation of filmgoers who only know him as a name-taking butt-kicker. Below are five of our favorites.

~

1. Satisfaction (1988)

This teen coming of age film follows a mostly female band (complete with Julia Roberts on left-handed bass) looking for their one big break. In this case, that big break comes in the form of Liam Neeson’s club-owning character, Martin Falcon. Neeson gets to hook up with the much-younger Justine Bateman character, and plenty of hilarity and drama ensue en route to the predictably happy ending.

 

2. Love Actually (2003)

This holiday-themed romantic comedy boasts quite the ensemble cast, with Neeson starring alongside the likes of Hugh Grant, Keira Knightley and Alan Rickman. It has a particularly high creep-factor for being a holiday rom-com, including Neeson’s character helping his young son get over the untimely death of his mother by encouraging him to pursue a love interest who just so happens to share the mother’s name. Ew!

See the rest of our Liam Neeson list on Radio.com

item.title: Miranda Lambert’s Cheat Food
item.dc:creator: katkmps
item.description: Miranda Lambert has worked hard to eat healthier and stay fit, but sometimes a girl just has to get down with some comfort food.
item.content:encoded:
Miranda Lambert has worked hard to eat healthier and stay fit, but sometimes a girl just has to get down with some comfort food.

The blonde bombshell admitted that she has no problem still eating greasy food.

Lambert told Elle, “I was at the Loveless Cafe in Nashville. I’d never been there and basically caused a scene with my biscuit eating.”

Not sure how many biscuits she downed, but she did own up to it. She added, “I got back out on the road, where I’m traveling with my trainer, and I was like, ‘I need to confess something.’ He was like, ‘It’s okay, but we’re going to run today.'”

When it comes to fad diets and calorie counting, Lambert is not a fan. She went on to say “I don’t think diets work. I think it’s a choice you make every single day.”

Lambert’s fit new physique has even gotten some fan feedback during concert meet & greets. Lambert said, “This girl came up to me in a meet & greet and said, ‘Just so you know, it’s because of you that I threw away my scale.’

“That’s the best help I could provide because I’ve been a lot of sizes in my career. I’ve always tried to rock what I’ve got, no matter what my body is at the time. She was like, a normal size girl, and for her to say that, it really made me feel good.”

item.title: Sam Hunt Plays Hero in Intense New Music Video for ‘Take Your Time': Watch
item.dc:creator: cbskapost
item.description: Hunt comes to the rescue in his new video for "Take Your Time."
item.content:encoded:
Sam Hunt just celebrated his second consecutive No. 1 on Billboard‘s Hot Country Songs chart with his latest single “Take Your Time,” and while the song, which he cowrote with Shane McAnally and Josh Osbourne, tells the tale of him talking to a girl, the video for the song takes a far more serious turn.

Related: New Music to Know: Sam Hunt Combines His Love For Usher & Steve Earle on Debut ‘Montevallo’

“Take Your Time” was filmed in Nashville last month and directed by Tim Mattia of London Alley Production. The video begins with a fight breaking out and it isn’t clear who is punching who. As the video continues, we see Hunt walking down a street alone.

Multiple story lines flush out that show Hunt observing a beautiful girl in a laundromat and at his open mic night, but she has big problems at home. The young mother is in an abusive relationship, and as the video develops we see she’s planning her escape. 

 

Read more on Radio.com

item.title: Tom Hanks Is The Best Girl Scout Ever
item.dc:creator: katkmps
item.description: Getting a box of Girl Scout cookies is already one of the greatest experiences, but how would amazing would it be if Tom Hanks was the one selling it to you?
item.content:encoded:
Getting a box of Girl Scout cookies is already one of the greatest experiences, but how would amazing would it be if Tom Hanks was the one selling it to you?

The Academy Award-winning actor was shopping in the San Francisco Bay Area over the weekend and he came across a Girl Scout troop selling cookies according to CBS News.

The actor not only bought four boxes of Girl Scout cookies and donated an additional $20 to the troop; he also offered to have his photo taken with people who recognized him, so long as they bought cookies, too.

As for what cookies the actor has a sweet tooth for, we may never know. The girl scouts didn’t reveal wether he went home with Thin Mints, Tagalongs or Samoas.

That will have to remain a mystery until next cookie season when Hanks might just stop by to help another troop hit their cookie goal.

@omgdannyp @tomhanks @girlscouts See, even Tom Hanks knows the Purple box is the best. pic.twitter.com/87vw6iseAU

— Rusty Prater (@BrontosauRUSS) March 13, 2015

item.title: ‘Grand Theft Auto’ Game To Be Adapted Into Television Drama
item.dc:creator: cbskapost
item.description: Grand Theft Auto, one of the biggest video games in the world, is going to see a new format soon—television.
item.content:encoded:
By Alyssa Pereira, CBS San Francisco

Grand Theft Auto, one of the biggest video games in the world, is going to see a new format soon—television.

Today the BBC announced that they will be developing a drama for television based on the game as part of their “Make It Digital” initiative, which revolves around technology.

Grand Theft Auto V, which took in around $800 million in its first 24 hours on sale and broke $1 billion in its first three days.

As the series is very popular, most gamers are aware of GTA’s graphic depictions of violence, sex and drug use. Many have condemned the game for its portrayals of women, saying it cultivates an unhealthy perspective of misogyny, and some stores have even banned the sale of the game.

Needless to say, the show will be the subject of some controversy.

As of yet, there is no news about the premise or premiere date for the new show.
